bug.short_desc: PHP error generated exclusively with Firefox 4.0

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Firefox 4.0 exclusively generate a PHP error when trying to display this page :
http://www.bibouille.net/?category/Sortir
Chromium 10 and IE 9 are ok it is a Dotclear2 based website
error :
Parse error: syntax error, unexpected $end in /srv/data_1/www/web5/web/cache/cbtpl/b2/1a/b21a60f4ac293bd959ee39a2acdfcc66.php on line 142
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. go to http://www.bibouille.net/?category/Sortir
Actual Results: Parse error: syntax error, unexpected $end in /srv/data_1/www/web5/web/cache/cbtpl/b2/1a/b21a60f4ac293bd959ee39a2acdfcc66.php on line 142
Expected Results: no PHP errors

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110406 Firefox/4.2a1pre
Works fine for me. Please try if you can reproduce it or if it works fine
1.in safe mode. https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
2.or by creating a new profile https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Managing+profiles#Creating_a_profile.

I have the same error even in Safe mode
Empty the firefox cache has apparently make the bug to disappear.
Nothing was fixed here (sorry, but it messes up the statistics).
